context: Act 2A Chapter 2.4 — Victory party. But something's wrong. Jade is distant. Hints of conspiracy.

lines.text: The Apex victory party. Rooftop bar overlooking Nova Pacifica harbor. The entire team is here — engineers, mechanics, marketing, PR. Everyone who touched the championship campaign is drinking champagne that the company can finally afford.
You are the center of gravity. People orbit you — handshakes, photographs, congratulations that blur together like mile markers on a highway.
Henrik is by the bar, nursing a single beer with the satisfied air of a man whose plan worked. He catches your eye and raises his glass. The nod that follows says more than any speech.
But Jade is wrong.

She is here — of course she is, this is her night more than anyone's — but she is on the periphery. Checking her phone. Stepping away for calls. Her smile, when she deploys it, doesn't quite connect to her eyes.
You have spent enough time with Jade Winters to know when the mask is performing and when it is malfunctioning. Right now, it is malfunctioning.
You find her at the edge of the rooftop, looking out at the harbor.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: Congratulations. You earned this.
She says it without turning around. Her voice is flat in a way that Jade's voice is never flat.

choices.text: We earned this. This was your championship too.
You've been on your phone all night. What's happening?

lines.label: jade_tells
lines.text: She takes a breath. Holds it. Lets it go.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: The board meeting was this afternoon. While you were at the photoshoot. They gave me the partnership. Fifteen years, and they finally—
She stops. Her jaw tightens.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: And then Dominic Weir showed me what the partnership really means. What being 'inside' really looks like.

lines.label: jade_deflects
lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: My championship. Right.
The bitterness is so faint you almost miss it. Almost.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: Can I tell you something? And can it stay between us?

lines.label: jade_caught
lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: You're observant. That's going to be a problem.
She pockets the phone. Turns to face you fully for the first time tonight.

lines.label: jade_revelation
lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: The championship we just won. It's real — your driving is real, Henrik's support was real, every lap you drove was genuine.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: But the field wasn't. Three of the races were managed. Competitors were paid to underperform. The championship was always going to come down to us and Kessler — because that's the story the league wanted to sell.
The words hit you like a wall at the end of a straight.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: I didn't know. I swear to you, I didn't know until today. Dominic showed me because now I'm 'inside' and insiders know how the machine works.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: Fifteen years. I built my career on believing this was real. And now I find out I was just another part of the show.

choices.text: We expose them. All of it. Burn it down.
Our driving was real. That's what matters.
What do you want to do about it?

lines.label: jade_afraid
lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: You don't understand what you're saying. These people — Dominic, the board, the sponsors — they are powerful in ways that transcend racing. They have lawyers. They have connections. They have the ability to make people disappear from this industry like they never existed.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: I want to expose them. I do. But I'm afraid. And I'm not used to being afraid.

lines.label: jade_disappointed
lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: That's what you take from this? That your driving was real? Three teams cheated to lose and you think that doesn't taint every result on the board?

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: I thought you were different. I thought the underground taught you that integrity matters.

lines.label: jade_decides
lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: I want to do what's right. I just don't know what that looks like yet. Give me time. I need to be smart about this.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: For now — enjoy tonight. You deserve to. Whatever's rotten underneath, you drove every lap honestly. Hold onto that.

lines.label: celebration_end
lines.text: She walks back to the party. The mask reassembles. The smile returns. She accepts a glass of champagne and laughs at someone's joke and nobody in the room can tell that the ground just shifted beneath her.
You stay at the edge of the rooftop. The harbor lights reflect off the water in wavering lines that look like the path you've driven to get here — beautiful from a distance, turbulent up close.
Champion. The word tastes different now. Not bitter. Not sweet. Just... complicated.
